description: If you're armed with weapons and a strong disrespect for authority, you might just want to take that Body Count song to heart and become a cop killer.
Manhunt 2 continues the suspense and stealth of the first game with a new design and storyline.
Grand Theft Auto III is, quite simply, an incredible experience that shouldn't be missed by anyone mature enough to handle it.

Grand Theft Auto V is an open-world crime epic set in the LA-inspired city of Los Santos around the lives of Franklin, a street hustler looking for real opportunities; Michael, a professional ex-con whose retirement isn't all he hoped it would be; and Trevor, a violent psychopath.
L.A. Noire is a single-player detective game from Rockstar Games set on the infamous streets and in the smoke-filled backrooms of postwar Los Angeles.
Max Payne 3 is the third installment in Rockstar Games Max Payne series and is set eight years after the events of the last installment.
The basic rule is drive fast and furious, and most of all, don't get caught.
Midnight Club: Street Racing takes the basic concepts and modes that made Midtown Madness so much fun and adds to it more hidden vehicles and a rudimentary plotline.
If you're finished with Tony Hawk, and you're hungry for another challenge, Thrasher: Skate and Destroy is the meal you're looking for.
Even though the gameplay is largely the same as in the previous GTA, it's still a lot of fun.
Grand Theft Auto: Vice City provides just about everything you'd want in a follow-up to an outstanding game.
The best part about State of Emergency is the way every facet of the game comes together to form a perfect feeling of panic.
Evel Knievel is all about precision - knowing when to tap what, how hard, and for how long is integral to making an enjoyable experience out of this game.
Smuggler's Run 2: Hostile Territory will instantly endear itself to fans of the original, as it is essentially a better-looking and more fun version of the original.
Red Dead Redemption 2 is an epic tale of life in Americaâ€™s unforgiving heartland.
Rockstar's Western-themed shooter has some great style and enough fun moments to justify the rough edges.
Bully is an action game from Rockstar that takes place at Bullworth Academy, where you face bullies, mean teachers, and more.
Manhunt is an audacious game that backs up its extremely violent subject matter with solid stealth action gameplay.
The Warriors is based on the 1979 gang film of the same name. In the game, you'll play as the leader of a gang that is struggling to regain control of the streets of New York.
Grand Theft Auto takes it to the streets of Chinatown and onto the Sony PSP.
Table Tennis gets a next gen look on the Xbox 360, courtesy of Rockstar Games.
If it weren't for the terrible control scheme, horribly accurate AI, and confusing terrain, this game would still be overly simple.
Undead Nightmare Collection is an expansion for Red Dead Redemption.
The whole thing feels like it was slapped together in a supreme hurry to cash in on the release of the film.
Oni features fluid, dynamic animation, some exciting combat sequences, and a fairly involving story that links everything together. However, it suffers from a few very noticeable problems.
Gamers itchin' for a monster-truck fix should save their cash until the real thing rolls into town.
The Midnight Club street racing series rolls on to the PSP.
Red Dead Redemption is a third-person open-world adventure featuring reformed outlaw John Marston who is on a quest to save his family.
The surfing game genre may be sparse, but there are still several surfing games that are more worth your time than Surfing H3O.
Beaterator is a portable music mixer and features a collection of rhythm games and challenge modes.
After a long hiatus, 2K Games is bringing Duke back for gamers to enjoy Duke Nukem Forever.
GTA: The Trilogy includes GTA3, GTA: Vice City, and GTA: San Andreas in one package for the PS2.
Earthworm Jim 3D has something to discourage all types of people from playing it.
Rockstar Games Collection: Edition 1 bundles up Red Dead Redemption, Grand Theft Auto: Episodes from Liberty City, L.A. Noire, and Midnight Club: Los Angeles Complete Edition into one collection.

game: Grand Theft Auto: The Classics Collection
description: Grand Theft Auto: The Classics Collection includes the original Grand Theft Auto, the Grand Theft Auto: London expansion pack, and GTA2.
Grand Theft Auto IV builds on the series' rock solid foundation with an awe inspiring recreation of Liberty City.

game: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City Stories
description: The second PSP GTA game will return to the titular tropical metropolis of Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, but with an all-new storyline.
If you can't play this intense, original action game on any platform except the PS2, then that's where you should play it--but only by default.

The third installment in the Midnight Club series arrives with more speed, choices, and chrome than in previous editions. Midnight Club 3: DUB Edition delivers fast, open-city racing in Atlanta, San Diego, and Detroit, complete with eight-player online competition and vehicle customization.
The Midnight Club street racing series rolls on to the Xbox 360.

Set in the early 90s, the next installment in the Grand Theft Auto series brings you to San Andreas--a city troubled by gangs, drugs, and corruption. You'll follow a rising gang member in his journey to save his family and to take control of the streets.
Midnight Club II is just as solid as the original Midnight Club was in its day, and it features a handful of improvements.

game: Max Payne 2: The Fall of Max Payne
description: Max Payne 2 is just a remarkable production, and what it lacks in length or volume it more than makes up for in quality and density.

game: Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories
description: The Grand Theft Auto: Liberty City Stories is the PSP version of the crime action series, Grand Theft Auto. Once again, you can explore the expansive, interactive world of Liberty City as you unravel brand-new missions and storylines.
